doc.title: SMILE

description.text: Inference of structured signals in multiple sequences

doc.reference: Marsan L, Sagot MF (2001). Algorithms for extracting structured motifs using a suffix-tree with application to promoter and regulatory site consensus identification. J. of Computational Biology, 7:345-360.

comment.text: smile is a program that was primarily made to extract promoter sequences from sequences. The interest of this program is to infer simultaneously several motifs (calledboxes) that respects distance constraints. The user has to select criterias. In a first step of extraction, all signals respecting these criterias are found. In a second step, they are all statistically evaluated, aiming to detect the ones that are exceptionally represented in the original sequences.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: This file must contain at least two sequences, as you cannot detect motifs which are common to several sequences in one sequence!
xhtml:div.div:
Example data (click on [use example data] to load):
>sequence1 atagtagtagcatcagcatcgatccggactcgtcgcgagcactgacacgatc aatcgatgatgcacgacgatcgactgatgctacgtcgacatcgctgctgtcc >sequence2 gatccggactcgtcagcatcagcagcgatagtagtagcatcagcatcgatcc ggactcgtcgcgagcactgacacgatcatgctacgtcgacatcgcatgctac >sequenceN gtcgacatcgccgagcactgacacgatcatgctacgtcgacatcgcatgctac aatcgatgatccggactcgtcgcggatgcacgacagcatcagcagatcgactg

interface.label: Alphabet DNA Degenerated DNA Protein (Zvelebil Barton Taylor Sternberg, JMolBiol 195 (1987) Protein (Smith and Smith 1990)
Maximum number of N in a motif for degenerated DNA or protein alphabet.
Maximum number of purine (R) in a motif for degenerated DNA

label.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

interface.label: Maximum number of pyrimidine (Y) in a motif for degenerated DNA

Minimum percentage of sequences containing a motif (quorum)?
The percentage of sequences where at least one occurrence of a motif must appear to make it valid. 100 means that a motif must have occurrences in every sequences.

Total min length?
The minimal length of the whole motif, i.e. the sum of minimal lengths of each box. Warning: the length of the gaps between boxes mustn't me taken into account. The total minimal length may differ of the sum of boxs's minimal length: you can, for instance, infer motifs made of two boxes, with min length of boxes equals to 4 and a total min length equals to 10.

Total max length?
Same explanation as "Total min length". Excepted that a 0 length means "infinity"

Total substitutions?
Total maximum number of substitutions for the motif.

Number of shufflings?
The number of shufflings of the original sequences to realize for the evaluation of the statistical significance of the motifs found.

Length of the words to conserve during shufflings?
Length of the words to conserve during shufflings (usually 2).

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: This file must contain at least two sequences, as you cannot detect motifs which are common to several sequences in one sequence!

div.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The percentage of sequences where at least one occurrence of a motif must appear to make it valid. 100 means that a motif must have occurrences in every sequences.

The minimal length of the whole motif, i.e. the sum of minimal lengths of each box. Warning: the length of the gaps between boxes mustn't me taken into account. The total minimal length may differ of the sum of boxs's minimal length: you can, for instance, infer motifs made of two boxes, with min length of boxes equals to 4 and a total min length equals to 10.
Same explanation as "Total min length". Excepted that a 0 length means "infinity"
Total maximum number of substitutions for the motif.
The number of boxes that compose the motifs to infer. Imposed 1 for xml.
The number of shufflings of the original sequences to realize for the evaluation of the statistical significance of the motifs found.
Length of the words to conserve during shufflings (usually 2).
